intro: Siphocampylus macropodoides, commonly known as the broad-footed bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils in open habitats such as meadows and slopes. It has hairy stems and leaves that are often glandular, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Siphocampylus macropodoides is a perennial herb that blooms in summer, attracting pollinators like bees and butterflies.
